apiOperation.shortdesc: Allows you to set an individual trigger key/value pair for in-app message targeting

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Allows you to set an individual trigger key/value pair for in-app message targeting

apiOperation.shortdesc: Allows you to set multiple trigger key/value pairs simultaneously with a Map Triggers are used for targeting in-app messages.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Allows you to set multiple trigger key/value pairs simultaneously with a Map Triggers are used for targeting in-app messages.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Cancels a single OneSignal notification based on its Android notification integer ID.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Cancels a single OneSignal notification based on its Android notification integer ID.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes all OneSignal notifications from the Notification Shade.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes all OneSignal notifications from the Notification Shade.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If your application is set to require the user's privacy consent, you can provide this consent using this method.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If your application is set to require the user's privacy consent, you can provide this consent using this method. Until you call provideUserConsent(true), the SDK will not fully initialize, and will not send any data to OneSignal.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Deletes a single tag that was previously set on a user with sendTag or sendTags.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Deletes a single tag that was previously set on a user with sendTag or sendTags. Use deleteTags if you need to delete more than one.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Deletes one or more tags that were previously set on a user with sendTag or sendTags.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Deletes one or more tags that were previously set on a user with sendTag or sendTags.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Disposes the ANE

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Disposes the ANE

apiOperation.shortdesc: By default OneSignal plays the system's default notification sound when the device's notification system volume is turned on.

apiParam.apiDesc: Passing false means that the device will only vibrate unless the device is set to a total silent mode.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
By default OneSignal plays the system's default notification sound when the device's notification system volume is turned on.
If true(default) - Sound plays when receiving notification. Vibrates when device is on vibrate only mode.
If false - Only vibrates unless EnableVibrate(false) was set.
You can link this action to a UI button to give your user a different sound option for your notifications.

apiOperation.shortdesc: By default OneSignal always vibrates the device when a notification is displayed unless the device is in a total silent mode.

apiParam.apiDesc: Passing false means that the device will only vibrate lightly when the device is in it's vibrate only mode.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
By default OneSignal always vibrates the device when a notification is displayed unless the device is in a total silent mode.
If true(default) - Device will always vibrate unless the device is in silent mode.
If false - Device will only vibrate when the device is set on it's vibrate only mode.
You can link this action to a UI button to give your user a vibration option for your notifications.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Get the current notification and permission state.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Get the current notification and permission state.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Retrieve a list of tags that have been set on the user from the OneSignal server.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Retrieve a list of tags that have been set on the user from the OneSignal server. Android will provide a cached copy if there is no network connection.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns a single trigger value for the given key (if it exists, otherwise returns null)

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns a single trigger value for the given key (if it exists, otherwise returns null)

apiOperation.shortdesc: Call when user logs out of their account.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Call when user logs out of their account. This dissociates the device from the email address. This does not effect the subscription status of the email address itself.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Can temporarily pause in-app messaging on this device.

apiParam.apiDesc: The boolean that pauses/resumes in-app messages

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Can temporarily pause in-app messaging on this device. Useful if you don't want to interrupt a user while playing a match in a game.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Allows you to send notifications from user to user or schedule ones in the future to be delivered to the current device.

apiParam.apiDesc: Contains notification options, see OneSignal | Create Notification POST call for all options.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Allows you to send notifications from user to user or schedule ones in the future to be delivered to the current device.
Note: You can only use include_player_ids as a targeting parameter from your app. Other target options such as tags and included_segments require your OneSignal App REST API key which can only be used from your server.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Prompts the user for location permissions to allow geotagging from the OneSignal dashboard.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Prompts the user for location permissions to allow geotagging from the OneSignal dashboard. This lets you send notifications based on the device's location. See Location-Triggered Notifications for more details. Make sure you add location permissions in your AndroidManifest.xml and/or info.plist.

apiOperation.shortdesc: If your user logs out of your app, and you would like to disassociate their custom User ID rom your system with their OneSignal User ID, you will want to call this method.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If your user logs out of your app, and you would like to disassociate their custom User ID rom your system with their OneSignal User ID, you will want to call this method.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a single trigger for the given key

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes a single trigger for the given key

apiOperation.shortdesc: Removes a list/collection of triggers from their keys with a Collection of Strings

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Removes a list/collection of triggers from their keys with a Collection of Strings

apiOperation.shortdesc: Tag a user based on an app event of your choosing so later you can later create segments to target these users.

apiParam.apiDesc: Key of your choosing to create or update
Value to set on the key. NOTE: Passing in a blank String deletes the key, you can also call deleteTag or deleteTags.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Tag a user based on an app event of your choosing so later you can later create segments to target these users. Use sendTags if you need to set more than one tag on a user at a time.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Tag a user based on an app event of your choosing, so that later you can create segments to target these users.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Tag a user based on an app event of your choosing, so that later you can create segments to target these users.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Set an email for the device to later send emails to this address

apiParam.apiDesc: The email that you want subscribe and associate with the device

Generated auth hash from your server to authorize. (Recommended) Create and send this hash from your backend to your app after the user logs into your app. DO NOT generate this from your app! Omit this value if you do not have a backend to authenticate the user.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Set an email for the device to later send emails to this address

apiOperation.shortdesc: If your system assigns unique identifiers to users, it can be to have to also remember their OneSignal Player Id's as well.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: If your system assigns unique identifiers to users, it can be to have to also remember their OneSignal Player Id's as well. To make things easier, OneSignal now allows you to set an external_user_id for your users. Simply call this method, pass in your custom user Id (as a string), and from now on when you send a push notification, you can use include_external_user_ids instead of include_player_ids.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Setting to control how OneSignal notifications will be shown when one is received while your app is in focus.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Setting to control how OneSignal notifications will be shown when one is received while your app is in focus.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Disable or enable location collection (defaults to enabled if your app has location permission).

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Disable or enable location collection (defaults to enabled if your app has location permission).
Note: This method must be called before OneSignal init on iOS.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Enable logging to help debug if you run into an issue setting up OneSignal.

apiParam.apiDesc: Sets the logging level to print to the Android LogCat log or Xcode log.
Sets the logging level to show as alert dialogs.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Enable logging to help debug if you run into an issue setting up OneSignal. This selector is static, so you can call it before OneSignal init.

apiOperation.shortdesc: For GDPR users, your application should call this method before initialization of the SDK.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
For GDPR users, your application should call this method before initialization of the SDK.
If you pass in true, your application will need to call provideConsent(true) before the OneSignal SDK gets fully initialized. Until this happens, you can continue to call methods (such as sendTags()), but nothing will happen.

apiOperation.shortdesc: The user must first subscribe through the native prompt or app settings.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The user must first subscribe through the native prompt or app settings. It does not officially subscribe or unsubscribe them from the app settings, it unsubscribes them from receiving push from OneSignal. You can only call this method with false to opt out users from receiving notifications through OneSignal. You can pass true later to opt users back into notifications.

apiOperation.shortdesc: The ANE instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: The ANE instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the FirebaseAnalytics instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the FirebaseAnalytics instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the FirebaseAuth instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the FirebaseAuth instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the Crashlytics instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the Crashlytics instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Disposes the ANE

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Disposes the ANE

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the FirebaseDynamicLinks instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the FirebaseDynamicLinks instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the FirebaseFirestore instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the FirebaseFirestore instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Initialise the ANE

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Initialise the ANE

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the FirebaseMessaging instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the FirebaseMessaging instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the FirebaseRemoteConfig instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the FirebaseRemoteConfig instance.

apiOperation.shortdesc: Returns the FirebaseStorage instance.

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Returns the FirebaseStorage instance.

apiValue.shortdesc: returns true if the user has the required version of Google Play Services.

apiValueDetail.apiDesc: returns true if the user has the required version of Google Play Services. Always returns true on iOS.
